website_summaries.verdict: This switch is perfect for anyone with a smart home device that wants to integrate a smart dimmer switch to their arsenal of wireless tools.
pros: Switch automatically remembers most recent brightness setting after being turned off
Includes multiple paddles to match aesthetic of any home
Compatible with dimmable LED, CFL, incandescent and halogen bulbs
LED indicator light can be turned on or off
cons: Requires a smart hub – such as Amazon Alexa, SmartThings, ADT Pulse, etc

customer_reviews.title: Gen 2 dimmers all flawed: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I confirm reviewer Chris Bunting's findings... the new 2nd Gen dimmers with QuickFit are flawed. Using them with a dimmable Feit 850lumen (Costco purchased) LED recessed light setup (5 ttl lights), the lights flicker at high speeds (almost have to stare off angle from the lights to see it clearly), the switch itself has a noticeable high speed clicking (not the typical quieter buzz of gen 1), and most importantly, the dimmer function does not work for these lights. (I replaced a non smart wave dimmer, so I know it is not the lights themselves.) I highly recommend reading Chris's review. And DO NOT BUY Gen 2! I have like 16 of the Gen 1 and they are all great.
customer_reviews.author: Derek W. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Does not dim
customer_reviews.text: Bought this new dimmer mostly because of "smartfit" because I always had issues fitting the dimmer from last generation because they were so big. However the dimmer functionality does not seem to work well. It goes from full brightness to just a little less bright. I am using the Phillips LED dimmer bulbs. These same bulbs have had no issue with the dimmer from previous generation. Something seems seriously faulty with these new dimmers.
customer_reviews.author: Saurabh

customer_reviews.title: Disco City
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews before i purchased this. Not sure what LED light this thing is supposed to be compatible with. I replaced 3 existing/working dimmers with these to start home automation. All three of them flicker like mad. GE's FAQ says it could be a compatibility problem with the LED bulbs I have. Three different bulbs seem to be compatible with other manufactures dimmer, but not this one... Swapped out to Lutron dimmers and they are fine now. So if you want flashing lights for your Discotheque, these may be the perfect fit for you. If you want them in your office or den, better look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pure garbage
customer_reviews.text: My old hub died and now I am going through the torture of trying to exclude a wired wall outlet with virtually NO instructions available online on how to do this. This whole system has been crap from day one, but I made the mistake of heavily investing in it before realizing this. I've vowed to sell all of this trash online and switch to something different. There really is no excuse for how bad this is. Charges should be filed against Samsung. It's that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Speerdo

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few months then dead.
customer_reviews.text: Paired with smartthings just fine. The actual switch has a slow response, I feel like I’m standing there forever to dim a light to where I wanted it. Worked fine as a smart switch for a few months before it died. Now it doesn’t work as a dumb switch OR a smart switch. I have Novelli brand smart switches that go unresponsive sometimes, and switching the power on and off will reboot them. This ones just simply dead.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: The only brand of smart switches in my house, new and improved.
customer_reviews.text: This newest revision of the GE Z-wave dimmer by Jasco has been well improved. There is now a jumper for the ground wire to make daisy-chaining multiple switches even easier. The switch housing itself is smaller allowing more room behind to fit the bundle of wires into the electrical box, and there are no break-away tabs like on the previous generations. The auto-detection of Line/Load seems gimmicky and hopefully does not lead to any issues down the line. I used this switch with an older gen fan control, so I had to be certain of which side was hot. Quick to detect in Smartthings and works as great as they always do.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice.... I wish there were more custom config parms....
customer_reviews.text: These work great. First of all, I wish they would do this new form factor in the old "toggle style" - we have nothing "decora" in our house so these look a little out of place. That being said, they work wonderfully. The new simplewire makes it a breeze to install, the addition of a scene controller adds new scheduling flexibility. My only wish is that there were more custom configuration paramaters for the dimming ramp rate. These slowly dim to off when you turn the lights off - and its annoyingly slow. On the old ones, you could easily configure this - on the new ones, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Web Geek

customer_reviews.title: BARELY LAST THE WARRANTY PERIOD: Switch burns out
customer_reviews.text: These "GE" parts are made by JASCO. Know that you will not be receiving GE quality or GE support. I bought twenty of these z-wave switches to turn a whole home into a smart home. After three years, half the switches have failed during normal usage, most of them just outside the two year warranty. A couple failed before the warranty expired, JASCO replaced, and those refurbished replacements quickly failed, just outside the original warranty period. These are cheap products that will not last. Buy your z-wave switches from another company.
customer_reviews.author: dman341

customer_reviews.title: Excellent smart home switch
customer_reviews.text: I have used both generations of this switch and the current generation brings some big improvements. The most notable is that this is a smaller form factor which is much appreciated in the remodel world. When I'm doing new construction I routinely use very large J-boxes but this switch fits fairly readily into most existing installations. The wiring was never complicated but is easier now with line/load interchangeable leads just in case you didn't know or care which was which - the switch autosenses and does the rest. Of course a neutral (and ground) are still needed as there is actual circuitry in this device. Pairing with a smartthings network was easy and straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: RMK

customer_reviews.title: Take on the task of replacing the electrical box with an extra deep old work box.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, the thing takes up some real estate. For people who have issues with fit, take on the task of replacing the electrical box with an extra deep old work box. It's easy to do. Then you will have plenty of space for all those wires. Something like this:, I have also found these clips make cake of wire connectors:. What is great about the connectors is that they are FLAT so again they help with utilizing all available space in the box.
customer_reviews.author: M. M.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Wink
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of these. The work with my wink system. One note - when setting up on Wink, at the end it usually say “success” but I’ve noticed the last couple switches, the wink app just sits there and retrys even though they’ve been added. Stop the app and restart and you’ll see the device, edit to give it a name. I just wish these were $10 less! Make sure you have AC power in your switchbox. If you Look in and see a wire nut connecting white wires, you’re probably ok. If you just a black and white going to the Existing switch, The power probably runs to the fixture and this probably won’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Steve STop Contributor: Golf

customer_reviews.title: Reliable?
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't planned to review a light switch, but I got an email asking, so here it is. When it works, it's very good. BUT....our same switch was just past two years old, so no longer under warranty. I turned the lights on, and they flashed and all went off. A call to Jasco revealed that the flashing blue light and clicking meant it had "burned out" beyond repair. And, they recommended getting it out of the wall as a failed electrical component. Therefore, this order to Amazon for a quick replacement, as neither Lowe's nor Home Depot carry them. I hope this one lasts more than just past the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Sportstick

customer_reviews.title: My favorite smart switch
customer_reviews.text: I've tried quite a few different approaches for smart lighting and have settled on these switches as the best value - features and price combination. Installation is easy and they offer the right combination of smart features while keeping the ability to turn on and off the lights at the switch. The only downside is reliability. I have 6 of these now, and I've had to replace two of them after about 2 years. They eventually start flashing the blue light and don't work anymore. I talked to tech support and they said they just have to be replaced. I hope the quality has improved in more recent versions.
customer_reviews.author: EquinoxV

customer_reviews.title: Simple and works
customer_reviews.text: I have been using 7 of them for couple of months now. So far they are flawless. I never had any trouble pairing them with my hub. They are always responsive and always work as expected. I am very happy with my purchase. Setting them up in a 4 gang box is a whole different story though. It's a battle between me and the box. I definitely recommend them. Although I feel the smart switches are generally overpriced. I am playing with couple of low cost option with IFTTT integration.
customer_reviews.author: Shiblee Sadik

customer_reviews.title: SO ADDICTING!!!
customer_reviews.text: So over the past two years, I have been installing these replacing all my on off switches with these Smart Dimmers. The New GE Z-Wave Plus Smart Control Dimmer Switch is the best on the market. I love how all the switches even 2 way are in the neutral position just looks better for my OCD. You wont be disappointed with these switches, and you will come back to buy more once you do a few they are just that good. Took me sometime to find a decent dimmable LED that wont hum or start flickering at the lowest dim. Buy these!
customer_reviews.author: JustMeEP

customer_reviews.title: Strobes with LED light, get the older version
customer_reviews.text: Even at full brightness my dimmable LEDs strobe on and off. The older version with the break off tabs works much better and is cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazons Customers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how easy this was to install. The instructions are clear and the terminals are well labeled. It even came with the neutral wire. I installed one in the garage to control my coach lights via Wink and Alexa. It is so nice having the lights on a programmed schedule now. Using the dimmer I can dial down the brightness with either the switch or my mobile app.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Good while it works
customer_reviews.text: I have about 12-15 GE (Jasco) switches in my house. They were not too difficult to install in my house since the electric is modern. I used these with a Wink Hub and am now using with a Hubitat Hub. When they work, the are good and I was happy with them. Problem is - I keep experiencing failures with these devices. Mine are between 3-5 years old. When they fail, you get a strobing light effect. They have to be replaced after this happens. I think the failure rate is poor. I am trying a different brand out when the next GE switch fails.
customer_reviews.author: Steakman

customer_reviews.title: Works but is affected by ham radio transmissions
customer_reviews.text: This switch worked great until my husband acquired some new ham radio gear. We knew the hobbies MIGHT collide... and they did. By turning the lights in the master on, and off, and on, and off, and on, and off. "But it doesn't work that way!!!" ... Yes, yes it does. Moved it to my son's room and got a different zwave dimmer for the master, and it's all fine. But in the right location, with the right transmissions, this switch can be triggered outside your system while you sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK WITH LED LIGHTS - THEY FLICKER!  F-
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work with LED lights (someone else had posted this and they are correct (wish I would have read that beforehand))... I wasted my time and effort hooking it up (correctly as I have over a dozen other GE Z-Wave light switches in my house that work perfect - even two with dimmers) - but this new model dimmer doesn't work with LED lights - they flicker / strobe at most setting lower than 100% and everytime you turn them off they flicker... Grade: F-
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dimmer light control
customer_reviews.text: I like being able to get home and have the light turn on inside and be able to control the intensity of the light from anywhere I am with my phone. Now I have control of the entry light in my house based on time, presence, movement, etc. The Z-wave communication gives me room not to put everything on WIFI (2.4 or 5) and make my other devices run slow. I have several of these SW and with a button on my phone (good night) I can turn off all the lights at the same time. I am happy with this dimmer SW.
customer_reviews.author: zorro55

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Gen GE Zwave switch does not work.  LED Light Flickers!
customer_reviews.text: GE Zwave Dimmer Switch (2nd Gen) do not work with 3way (add on switch) LED Lights. The Lights Flickers regardless what dim level. I believe it has something to do with "simple wire". As single pole dimmer switch works fine with LED lights. 1st Gen GE Zwave Dimmer switch works great with 3 way (add on switch) LED Lights. Also I ordered a 2nd Gen GE Zwave dimmer switch with add on switch, for some reason amazon sent me with 2 add on switch instead. Going to return the items and buy the 1st Gen Dimmer switch.
customer_reviews.author: J9

customer_reviews.title: The Best In My Opinion
customer_reviews.text: I have several Z-Wave dimmers. Over the past couple of years, I've slowly installed more and more of them. When I buy them, I always look for GE brand. I think they are the easiest to use. I think they look great. I've found them to be very reliable and to stay connected over a long range. I highly recommend this dimmer and this brand. My one knock is that they are big and can be difficult to install in the box if there are multiple wires or multiple switches.
customer_reviews.author: CautiousBuyer

customer_reviews.title: LED lights are flickering, 1st Gen was so smooth .. Buyers be aware
customer_reviews.text: LED lights are flickering at a high rate, I don't have any problem with the first-generation switches. Also when switch is turned on, lumination doesn't go up smoothly, it almost jumps in intermittently. Buzzing sound is more with this switch Is there any fix to this. Is there a firmware fix for this??? I thought the new generation will be better so I have canceled my first-generation order and bought the second generation.
customer_reviews.author: Sivarama krishna

customer_reviews.title: Had to get more, love them.
customer_reviews.text: I’m addicted to these things. I have 5 already and bought 5 more here. Also have other GE items for Z-Wave and they are clearly the best. I use them with SmartThings and have worked for two years flawlessly. New house, more switches and I want more automation. Also love I tell the Amazon Echo to do something and it works with SmartThings and controls these lights. I also have another house with same setup and 3 of these in use, I control all remotely. I still want 6 more of these, buy in phases. Plus a few other z-wave items, if I find GE I always stick to them.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Turner

customer_reviews.title: Does not dim LED lights, rather it just causes them to flash.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to install and connect to Z-Wave Cons: Completely unable to dim my dimmable LED recessed lights. When attempting to dim lights, the Lights just begin to flash. Fade on/off does not work with LED and leads to flashing when turning on/off. Absolutely do not get these if you plan on trying to dim LED lights. I replaced these with the comparable Leviton dimmer switch and it is able to control and dim lights flawlessly. This product simply does not work as a dimmer and should not be advertised as such.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony H. Sarracino

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but useful
customer_reviews.text: The good: - Allows me to remotely turn off lights on a common vendor neutral protocol (Z-wave) The bad: - There is a buzzing in the controller and the lights. We have 3 new LED lights attached. You can hear them when very close or when there is dead silence. - The on/off switch is sometime finicky. You have to press them longer if they get "stuck" to turn lights on/off - there is a delay of a few milliseconds when switching on/off the lights
customer_reviews.author: T. Le

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvements!  Easier for DIY folks.
customer_reviews.text: These new zwave light switches are light years ahead of theor previous generation. Lots to like including a slimmer profile that makes for an easier fit inside the switch box. Additionally, you don't have to worry about getting load and line wires crossed since the switch figures out which is which and adapts. Lastly, the ease of changing colors of the switch plate is a snap, all of which combined makes it easier for the DIY folks. Great enhancements! 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: gwade56

customer_reviews.title: Works very well so far. Installation easy.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy enough. Directions are clear. Just make sure you have a neutral wire (usually white) prior to purchase. Without a neutral wire it won't work. The only thing that's not perfect is that when you turn on the light, it slowly brings the light to full brightness instead of the usually instant on. Considering it's installed in a bedroom, it's not a huge deal but I could see how it's be annoying in a kitchen / living room. Price also seems to be a bit high for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Confirm Your Wiring
customer_reviews.text: I was heartbroken to find that my home’s brand new wiring, installed by a professional and licensed electrician to national electrical code, was not compatible with these switches. The switches look and feel nice — I prefer the aesthetics of the GE switches to those that actually worked. In the end, function won the day and the GE switches are being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Smartthings and Google Assistant! Needs a neutral wire.
customer_reviews.text: Paired with Smartthings hub to be able to voice control lights in our living room and bedroom. Works amazingly well and pairs easily. Make sure you have a neutral wire in the switch box before you buy these! Most newer homes have them in every box. However some older homes may only have a power wire and not a neutral in some switch boxes. The neutral wire is used to help power the wireless bits in these switches which is why you need one. Double check your boxes if your house is older!
customer_reviews.author: Ike Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Terrible touch controls
customer_reviews.text: The unit works great when controlled through my z-wave hub, but using the switch via the touch control is horrible. It is slow to respond and behaves seemingly randomly when I touch various points on the switch. Touching the top of the switch sometimes turns it on, sometimes changes the dimmer, and sometimes dims and then turns it off. Trying to dim by moving my finger up and down the panel works until I remove my finger from the panel at which point the switch turns off the light. I usually control the dimming through Alexa via my z-wave hub or this switch would be unusable.
customer_reviews.author: jwild3r

customer_reviews.title: A home automation switch that simply works, and works well!
customer_reviews.text: I have messed around with various home automation (HA) switches and systems since back in the X10 days. I've been replacing my switches with these, and I simply love them. They work great manually, dim easily and smoothly, and support the remote HA controls including scenes -- I'm using a Wink Hub and Alexa for voice control. Don't forget you MUST HAVE ALL 3 WIRES (hot, neutral, and the load)! I've installed six so far, just ordered 4 more. They install easily, elegant wire connections (reduces wire nuts), and pair to Wink very easily. No hesitation, they work great.
customer_reviews.author: R. Meisner

customer_reviews.title: Great switch!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this switch on some indoor dimmable LEDs ove rmy mantle. installation was pretty easy, just remember to use a nuetral wire even if your original set-up didnt have one. The dimmer function works great with ALexa and ADT. I plan on buying more of these switches going forward. ...only thing I would "change" is that I look forward to the parts miniaturizing with technology improvements, it takes up alot of space in the switch box.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Works on certain configurations
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of the second generation switches and could only get it to work on one bedroom that had 2 led bulbs. The other bedroom had 4 led bulbs and it would not dim. I even purchased another set of LED bulbs to see if that was the issue. I also own 2 of the first generation switches (GE 14291). If I were to do it again, I would buy the first gen switches or go with Lutron PD-6WCL (but they are really expensive). I installed a Lutron switch and the dimming worked right out of the box. So I'm returned the GE one, bummer. I gave 3/5 starts because it worked fine in one bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: wheres-waldo

customer_reviews.title: LED flicker at lower settings
customer_reviews.text: These cause my LED bulbs to flicker at lower settings, and have a buzzing sound. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Goober9

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great when they work but will stop working quickly
customer_reviews.text: These things are crap. There were 4 already installed in my when I bought my home. I installed two more since moving in to keep consistent with my Smart Home setup. The Bluetooth loses connection and can't be reset. I've gone so far as to disconnect and completely reinstall the unit. For the price, this is unacceptable performance. All that said, when they work it is absolutely awesome. I just wish they could figure out the well documented connectivity issues with these units.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M. Miller

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THE GEN 2 VERSION!!!  Gen 1 Version is great.
customer_reviews.text: I should have heeded the other negative review about the gen 2 version of the switch but I wanted to try it in case supplies of gen 1 run out. Gen 2 is junk! Would not pair correctly not matter what I tried. It would show up as "unknown", did not have configuration parameters and only dims in harsh steps with Z-wave commands. Get gen 1s or another brand!
customer_reviews.author: Martin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love these switches, but they can sometimes be difficult to get wired up.
customer_reviews.text: I love the functionality of these switches once they're installed, but sometimes getting the wires on the terminals in the small space around the screws can be annoying. I usually find myself cursing while trying to fit the wires around the terminal screws because there's very little space. Another issue I've encountered has been fitting them into the box in the wall. If there are a few lines coming together in the box it doesn't leave a lot of room for the big plastic enclosure on these switches.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Randall

customer_reviews.title: Don't like them very much - is hard to set the ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 50 of these for a remodel. Wish I'd tested a few first. Don't like them very much - is hard to set the dim without using the app.. Has an oddity where sometimes the light doesn't turn on - or reverses direction vis-a-vis the paddle. Works decently when used with SmartThings/Alexa - but the actual switches themselves leave a lot to be desired. Lutron one looks like it's got a better approach to dimming the light from switch... I've got a few more to do in the house - and, at the risk of mixing and matching, will try something else.
customer_reviews.author: BigRig

customer_reviews.title: Read if you’re using the switch for a 3 Way Install
customer_reviews.text: Review Part 1- I am writing this review regarding installation and not Z Wave integration. I am waiting for tech installer to put the system. My electrician installed the light switch to use on a 3 way switch. It would not work. He tried different ways to wire it, but still nothing. He said that it needs a comparable “Add On” switch where the other switch goes. I am waiting for my electrician to come back to install the “Add On” switches to see if it operates properly. I’ll update the review once that happens.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stefano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wiring instructions
customer_reviews.text: I bought many of the and installed them throughout the house. Three months of use now and they are all performing as advertised. Excellent wiring instructions. Some home wiring can be tricky, especially in older homes. And the included instructions covered several possible wiring scenarios (some of which I encountered). Well done GE/Jasco. Nice tactile feel, subtle dimming steps, simple SmartThings setup. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Boyd Shermis

customer_reviews.title: Works with dimmable LED lights
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, works great with my Edison style dimmable LED bulbs, no flickering whatsoever. Capable of relaying S2 encryption, which could be helpful if you have door locks or Z-wave security devices. It is easier than generation 1 to install in older gang electrical boxes due to the new slimmer design. Overall good product, price should be able to come down quite a bit if GE got some decent competition on these.
customer_reviews.author: Johan L

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what it saids an WIFI switch. Works great. I like I can control it from the switch, my phone or Alexa using my wink hub. I like that the switches remain live WIFI unlike conventional switches when they are off of I have WiFi bulbs they are off. This is WIFI active all the time which give you 100% control. Took me about 5 minutesnto install but be aware you need A white neural, Blacks wire power and then a Black wire going to the light. If you have no neural White this will not work. If works just fine. I have some zones in my home I want use a switch and this works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: SDNO

customer_reviews.title: Works with FrontPoint
customer_reviews.text: I am not an electrician but have some electrical knowledge. The switch was pretty straight forward to install (I recommend at least basic knowledge of how to wire a switch). Called FrontPoint, they helped me link to my hub. It took less than 10 minutes. Dimmer switch works as promised. Easy access from my phone app or at the wall. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product, easy install
customer_reviews.text: I liked this so much I bought one for all the rooms in my house. Super easy install- I watched an electrician wire one and I was good to go for the rest. I have it wired to a Wink Hub 2 and it works seamlessly. The only downside is that I keep showing off the wink/smart switch combo to other people and flipping the lights on and off remotely. Drives my wife bananas if she’s sitting in the living room.
customer_reviews.author: John Flemming

customer_reviews.title: Wireless control with Alexa or manual switch.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Alexa as well as manually by pressing the up and down buttons. The manual buttons are excellent in cases when Alexa loses connectivity. However, manually setting the brightness is a bit finicky since it starts up slowly and then suddenly goes to full brightness if you don''t let go of the switch soon enough. Works well with LED lights and the dimmer setting can be precisely controlled through Alexa. Installation requires a bit of electrical knowledge. Neutral wire is required. A bit on the pricey side but has worked flawlessly so far.
customer_reviews.author: Shikuka

customer_reviews.title: Loved it. Buying 3 more.
customer_reviews.text: So easy to install. The install and configuration was a breeze. Well made product. I bought Inovelli gen 2 but it would not connect to my ring security. I guess there is a reason they are cheaper. This switch is less thick then those cheap ones. Fits in a2 gang box early. Connecting this to ring was easy too.
customer_reviews.author: Rp

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from older versions
customer_reviews.text: These reliable smartswitches are easy to install. These newer versions of the switch have been upgraded with a number of features that make installation easy in multi-gang boxes when you are installing multiple switches. Also great to pair with add-on switches for three-way installs. One watch-out make sure if you are comparing prices that you order the right switch as the box images look fairly similar, dimmer switches cost a little more.
customer_reviews.author: LM7

customer_reviews.title: Does not color match Light Almond Leviton Screwless Wallplate
customer_reviews.text: Color is described as Light Almond. These don't match standard Light Almond faceplates readily available at Lowes and Home Depot. Similarly, the Honeywell Z-Wave Smart Switch which includes what they call Light Almond paddle does not match either. Granted it is subtle, a little too yellowish, but enough that you will notice the difference. If you are needing to color match Light Almond, Jasco, the manufacturer, does not have a solution for you. I will have to go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, easy to pair with Samsung SmartThings
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Samsung SmartThings. The way to wire a 3-way switch is a little different with this setup so instead of running power over to the 3-way add-on switch, you run a neutral and a traveler. The add-on switch functions the same as the main dimmer switch meaning you have full dimmer functionality from both switches.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Fix-it / Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Voice control is here to stay !
customer_reviews.text: Making my home a smart home. Looked at changing light bulbs versus installing light switches. It worked out light switches were the better way to go. You can by a regular or toggle or either in a dimmer style. Once installed, very easy, you now have a switch you can control the lights by the regular way, boring lol, or by Alexa or by your phone. Better keep up with the technical stuff or you will be hostages to your kids or neighbors later on in life. Automation is the rave and voice commands are here to stay.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage -  LEDs flicker at all brightness levels
customer_reviews.text: If you need to control a small LED load, avoid this switch like the plague. I never tested the Z-Wave+ integration because its dimmer performance is so poor.
customer_reviews.author: Tad

customer_reviews.title: Flickering and humming with low profile LED recessed lighting.
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try these instead of a traditional wifi dimmer. Pairs easily. Bought 4 and installed one so far. Barely used the dimmer to turn the lights on less than 10 times and now it flickers at 100% when used with 6 led slim ceiling lights and there's an audible humming. Not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get it you will be very happy
customer_reviews.text: G.e for me( I have tried a few) is the best smart switch I have purchased. It was very easy to install easy to set and easy to use it has a fast response when using alex or the Alexa app or even from the smartthings hub(I own) and the best part it that you can use it in 1 location or but more and turn it to a2 way, 3 way so on
customer_reviews.author: Bobby E.

customer_reviews.title: It's more time unavailable than working!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality! Actually it's not working at all. I installed four of them with 5 feet distance to smartthings hub and it's loosing connection several times per day. Responses are very slow too. If you turn it on/off or dim through smartthings app or action tiles it takes 5-10 sec to do something! There are a lot of good working smart dimmers and outlets in the market and this one IS NOT! It's all about glitches and problems!
customer_reviews.author: Anton Kuznetsov

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended if you have an older style single gang box.
customer_reviews.text: Spent all morning trying to make it work. No joy. Huge switch housing fills an entire single gang box (width and depth). If you have a double gang box, it should fit if you shove all the wires to the side. But for a single gang box, I found it impossible to fit with all the wires and twist caps, without the switch sticking out about 1/4".
customer_reviews.author: TekzMekz

customer_reviews.title: EZ connect tip here
customer_reviews.text: EZ connect tip-Just keep pressing the on switch rapidly while the hub tries to find it. The instructions say to press it, but not that it helps to keep pressing it. Just do the On, so you don’t accidentally reset it. I connected 5 new switches in about 3 minutes. Love them, and they make my battery powered stuff stay connected.
customer_reviews.author: Phil B

customer_reviews.title: No matter how many times I set the light percentage ...
customer_reviews.text: No matter how many times I set the light percentage at 100%, every time I go back to settings, it is at 99%. Not a huge deal, but if you press and hold the paddle instead of hitting it quickly and releasing, it dims the light significantly. The switches that I have that are non-dimming work flawlessly. These are just problematic.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: They flicker with LEDs
customer_reviews.text: After the switch warms up, it flickers terribly, worst smart switch i've ever used. Installed easily though! Returning it for sure.
customer_reviews.author: mandraketeck

customer_reviews.title: Solid Z-wave switch with Z-wave plus
customer_reviews.text: Arrived earlier than expected. The new Zwave plus switch is the exact same size as the previous model the 12724 and looks identical. The function of the switch feels very solid and the installation was just as easy as always. The additional color faceplace is perfect for those needing light almond colors and matches existing normal switches perfectly. No problems pairing and operating with Samsung smartthings, but does not appear to have any of the new features such as instant status or scenes as of yet.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Best Smart Switch on Market.
customer_reviews.text: The best smart switch I have tried. A little clunky to install with a Wink 2 hub, but once installed is 100% reliable. I have tried several other brands including Lurton, none of which compare in quality and reliability. Lastly, it’s a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Controls my dining room chandelier with 5 led bulbs, ...
customer_reviews.text: Controls my dining room chandelier with 5 led bulbs, dimmer feature works well. Dims effectively from 10% through 100% with my old fixture and cheap led dimmable bulbs Amazon asin B071KX21V5 (CRLight LED Candelabra Bulb 6W 2700K Warm White 700LM, 60W Equivalent E12 Base Dimmable LED Candle Bulbs, B11 Clear Glass Torpedo Shape Bullet Top, 360 Degrees Beam Angle, Pack of 6). I do occasionally notice very minor flickering around 25% and below, but no guest has mentioned or noticed it.
customer_reviews.author: VJL

customer_reviews.title: 50% Failure Rate
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my most of the switches in my living areas we the GE paddle switches. These were installed by an electrician since I’ve never installed these types of switches before. After a two switches had stopped working, I decided to have a whole home surge protector installed. I’ve now had an additional 3 switches stop working....I’m almost at 50% failure rate and I’ve these only for a few years. All the switches that stopped working were not recoverable through the troubleshooting methods and after that the only option to buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: My first venture into smart lighting, and these things hooked up to my ...
customer_reviews.text: My first venture into smart lighting, and these things hooked up to my Smartthings hub like a breeze. Set the hub to "Add new device" mode, press up on the switch, and boom, there it is. Finally did some 3 way add-on switches and went really smooth. This is also a cheaper route than buying 2 3-way dimmer switches, at $35+/ea with the added benefit of smart controls.
customer_reviews.author: Ben S.

customer_reviews.title: Remove "wings" for multi-gang boxes
customer_reviews.text: First I was frustrated that the switch didn't fit next to a leviton zwave switch in a double wall plate. Then I realized the wing things can be removed with pliers. All is great. It is slow to respond to zwave commands, but I only use zwave for timers so no problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to connect, works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: Installing the switch was easy. Quick note you must have a neutral wire or it will not work. After the switch was installed It connected too my Samsung smart things hub easily and it is controlled through google home voice commands.
customer_reviews.author: C & K

customer_reviews.title: Happy so far...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I received the product as described. It’s been only a few days since I installed the switch. So far everything is working like it should and am pretty happy with the product. I’ll most likely purchase a few more for my home. Install was easy. Though it says you can install the load line in either in/out port, I had to try both connections to get it working properly. Nothing major, but just a note to those thinking about buying this switch. Connected to my home alarm easily and is running good so far. I’ll update my review if anything changes, but happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: JMS

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to Install - Easy to install 3 Way and 4 Way Circuits
customer_reviews.text: This switch and its companion accessory switches are very easy to install. 3-way and 4-way circuits are very easy due to the design of this switch and its accessory switches. Adding to a Z-Wave Hub is one press of the Rocker, and you ready to control it.
customer_reviews.author: SpaceSkier

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Gen Dimmer Doesn't Work With Halo LEDs
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2nd gen dimmer switch (because it's 20% smaller) and it doesn't work with Halo LEDs. The light works but it doesn't dim and goes from just on to off. During the transition from on to off it'll flicker a few times like it's trying to dim, then just turn on/off. I've had an electrician look and it and said it's definitely the switch. I'll be returning mine.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Newman

customer_reviews.title: Works, but large insides
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Insert wires into the provided holes and tighten screws. Done! As many have mentioned you need the natural wire. These have a large enclosed plastic box that houses the workings of the switch. Could not fit two of them into an older metal dual gang box that had rounded corners, even when removing the breakaway tabs on either side as the instructions say. Very easy to add to a Wink hub and works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: T.M.

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to install
customer_reviews.text: This dimmer works well but unless you have a lot of electrical know how, it's a bit of a bear to install. Online videos are your friend. One definite lacking point is it doesn't come with a switch plate cover. I have a different cheaper switch that did. I would have expected a GE brand to as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ironf

customer_reviews.title: works great with alexa, but does not work with the Echo plus
customer_reviews.text: The echo plus hub doesn't work with the Z wave switches. The other echos do work. I used the Smart things hub and the echo plus still won't take the voice commands to turn it on and off. The echo dot and echo work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ibanez Musician

customer_reviews.title: This works as described and was super easy to connect
customer_reviews.text: This works as described and was super easy to connect. If there are any issues try pressing the little blue button on the bottom left and it should reconnect or be visible for connection. As others has mentioned it requires a neutral, which for us turned this from a 10 minute project to a 2 hour project chasing pipe. We now have 3 in our house and look forward to adding more.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne R

customer_reviews.title: Works great, tight fit in 14cu. in. box
customer_reviews.text: Works great with smartthings. I added some helpful notes for the adventurous DIY'er or an electrician installing these. The image with the original switches is to show the neutral wire in the back of the box (which is required). My house was built in the mid 80s and uses 2.75in deep boxes. These switches fit kinda and the boxes kinda work *sometimes*, it's a tight fit. I had to replace at least one of the boxes to the newer 4 inch deep box to accommodate 2 or more switches in the box. (picture with the checkered wallpaper)
customer_reviews.author: EbbieCL2016

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work!  Amazon wouldn’t take back
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the matching fan switch. I had an electrician come over after trying to install for 3 hours. After installed, the lights wouldn’t dim manually and the fan wouldn’t turn off manually unless I held it down for 5 long seconds. I decided to try to set up the smart prompts with Alexa. After four hours of trying, I couldn’t get the smart features to work either. I had to pay the electrician to come back and replace the old switches. Because this took so long, I am unable to return it to amazon. Costed me lots of money for NOTHING!! I’m annoyed with amazon as well for not taking them back.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret B.

customer_reviews.title: Flickers and Dims randomly
customer_reviews.text: The older generation of these worked great! I replaced several of these with the latest generation on they make my LED bulbs flicker randomly and the lights will randomly dim. I tried replacing the bulbs to newer dimmable LED's and still the same result. This is happening on all 6 switches. I have several of the older ones installed still and they are working flawlessly. Hopefully they get the bugs worked out but I would recommend only getting the 1st geration for now
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Zitting

customer_reviews.title: Works as Described
customer_reviews.text: This switch works extremely well. I installed it almost 2 years ago and haven't had an issue. Integrates well with Amazon Echo devices and ADT Pulse. So not only does it work as a regular manual switch, but I can control it from the ADT Pulse app (manually or through a scheduled rule), or by asking Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: F. H. Legaspi III

customer_reviews.title: Too Expensive for the low quality...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but i bought two of the switches and they both burned out in a year. I tested my hot wires and no issue, swapped light out with a normal switch and no issue. I called tech support and they agreed to replace the parts. They asks that I send them pictures which I did and now they won’t respond... It’s now been 7 days with 4 emails and 3 calls and a kitchen light that won’t turn on... I have other switches in the house that are way cheaper and work better. So far not a fan of this product and the customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing - Do your research.
customer_reviews.text: I have these switches throughout my home, about 18 months now. They have one by one started dying. Pretty expensive switches to only last a year an a half. I will pay a little more for Homeseer as none of those have failed.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Not as described, this model does not exist
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered "GE Enbrighten, White & Light Almond, Z-Wave Plus Smart Light Dimmer, Works with Alexa, Google Assistant, SmartThings, Wink, Zwave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, 3-Way Compatible, 2-pack, 47889", however what I got is 2 ZW3004, which are not paddles, but dimmer switches. In fact, googling "47889" finds only this particular amazon listing, GE doesn't seem to have such a model.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected - every time!
customer_reviews.text: GE Z-Wave devices cost a little more than the others, but you do get what you pay for. The GE devices setup easily, 100% of the time, and operate reliably 100% of the time. Other manufacturers devices are not always reliable Z-Wave repeaters; the GE devices always are. Don't hesitate to deploy GE Z-wave devices.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Installation is pretty straightforward. You have to use a neutral wire but other than that, nothing difficult. The smart hub finds the switch right away and configuration is a breeze. Configuring to work with Alexa is a little more challenging but not overly difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Integrate perfectly with Hassio and z-wave stick and Alexa guard!
customer_reviews.text: I like this switch especially because it works in the same way with normal switches, which is more natural than Lutron in my opinion. With Home Assistant integration it worked really well. Latency is unnoticable. No more bed lamp needed with voice control! And Hassio can integrate with Alexa Smart Home and Alexa guard can pit it in away mode to pretend people at home, super cool!
customer_reviews.author: qchero

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: You can not dim this unless you connect to the app!! Say away, it does not mentioned this anywhere!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elibeli2

customer_reviews.title: Flickers and strobe badly with LEDs.  Chris B review was correct.
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this dimmer but after a month, the flickering, strobing and inability to fully dim with new LED (6 @ 12watt each) lights forced me to replace the dimmer. Works great with incandescent but unliveable with LED's.
customer_reviews.author: dt44202

customer_reviews.title: Just works.  No problems.  Zwave.
customer_reviews.text: No hassles. No glitches. Works seamlessly with my Samsung Smart Things hub. This is a Zwave device. I make sure not to mix things up. My whole system is Zwave and I have zero problems. The amount of options for automatic control of these with the Smart Things Hub is insane. The switch is also manual. Sweet.
customer_reviews.author: I used to use electric

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Samsung Smart Hub. Amazon saved me a few bucks and a trip to the hardware store. I've bought two of these and will probable add more to my home later. They allow you to use the switch in the traditional way and with your Google Home or Alexa through the Samsung Hub
customer_reviews.author: Edward Bruning

customer_reviews.title: Good device but...
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a manual dimmer switch but the intended use never happened because of the Z wave hub was never able to read it and it was such a pain to remove it from the wall call an electrician again etc etc
customer_reviews.author: Mike.N

customer_reviews.title: Good controller... dimmer is very sensitive
customer_reviews.text: I have this switch linked to my Smartthings. It works great in that capacity, the dimmer switch is very touchy and doesn't allow the best control of the lights from the switch. I use the app to control lights more often than not because of this. It is a very good switch, no issues with linking it to my home!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Bricked after about 4 months.
customer_reviews.text: This switch worked great for about 4 months, then just died today. Now it's just a brick in my wall. These things are a pain to install, I would have preferred to buy a product that lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Good switch.
customer_reviews.text: This switch works great with Google Home plus Samsung Smart Hub. Controls ceiling fan lights that are dimmable. Bought it to match a fan switch which I could only find in a rocker style.
customer_reviews.author: PAPA

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Took 5 minutes to install. The Zwave plus responds much faster than WiFi bulbs. Prefer response and low cost of these smart switches over smart bulbs. If I started my smart home over I would use all smart switches. Haven’t tried other brand switches but probably won’t because these work flawlessly so far. I also saw people’s reviews that said won’t work with led bulbs but all my bulbs are led and haven’t had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon g.

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2, 1 failed after 12 months of light use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these units to pair with my Home Assistant setup. Both dimmer switches are in an outside office I use seldomly, maybe two-three times a week for 2-3 hours at a time. Last Saturday I had the switches on for a few hours in the evening and everything worked as expected. Sunday morning I came in and one of the dimmer switches was no longer working. 50% fail rate after ~year of light service for something like this is pretty pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: I love these switches
customer_reviews.text: I have both the dimming and non dimming versions of these switches. They integrate perfectly with my Nexia (Trane) thermostat which acts as the hub, and even work well in my detached garage to control the driveway lights. Wiring was self explanatory and quick, and Nexia integration took about 5 seconds. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas N.

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I use these with SmartThings V2. They turn my exterior lights on at sunset and turn them off at a specific time. They work well and feel well made. The price is a bit high.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I no longer have to get up To flip a switch
customer_reviews.text: Worked as described. Easy to install once you understand the directions. I felt the directions for a non-electrician (me) were a little vague but I finally figured it out. I like being able to control my home lighting using my phone so I no longer have to get up. Lazy I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Carrison

customer_reviews.title: I use them with a vera plus and like them a lot
customer_reviews.text: Started with the Linear on off and dimmer switches through out my house and now i am switching to these cause of the instant status..The linear switches wont tell the controller the switches status if manually pressed...These report back to the controller..I use them with a vera plus and like them a lot .Ge makes quality stuff anyways
customer_reviews.author: Len Ricupero

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, quality product
customer_reviews.text: I have a smart home and use Smartthings. It was a very simple setup. Once you get the switch installed correctly (make sure you follow every part, step by step) make sure you also put the wire in the proper holes. The wires have two places they can go, if the wire is on the top of the box, make sure you put it in the top hole. And then tighten it the correct way. Using the smartthings app to connect it, it took seconds. Very simple.
customer_reviews.author: Jason A. Brammer

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Samsung Smart things and Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this wireless switch since it was far away from the bed, so I can use Alexa to turn it on/off. it does require a Z-Wave hub like Smart Things which recognized it after a minute or so. So far I'm very happy with this device and would definitely recommend to folks looking to switch a manual dimmer to a smart dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: A to da J

product_meta.title: GE Enbrighten Z-Wave Plus Smart Light Dimmer, Works with Alexa, Google Assistant, 3-Way Compatible, ZWave Hub Required, Repeater/Range Extender, White & Light Almond, 14294
product_meta.description: Style:Dimmer (1st Gen.)| Color:White & Light AlmondSet the scene with the GE-branded Enbrighten Z-Wave Plus In-Wall Smart Dimmer. When paired with a compatible hub, the hardwired smart dimmer operates wall, ceiling and accent lighting through individual commands and programmed settings. Wirelessly control and schedule indoor or outdoor fixtures for effortless management of your home. Your automation possibilities are seemingly infinite when connected to hubs from Wink, SmartThings, HomeSeer, Vera, Nexia and more.
feature_bullets: VOICE CONTROL – ALEXA & GOOGLE ASSISTANT COMPATIBLE (requires a Z-Wave certified hub). Works with the following Z-Wave certified hubs: SmartThings, Ring Alarm, Wink, ADT Pulse, ADT Command, Trane, Vivint, Nexia, Honeywell, HomeSeer, Harmony Home Hub Extender, Vera and more.

VERSATILE DIMMING OPTIONS – Easily replace any standard in-wall switch equipped with a neutral wire to remotely turn ON/OFF, adjust lighting brightness and create schedules for a wide range of fixtures. The dimmer adjusts brightness levels of dimmable LED, CFL, incandescent and halogen lights from 0-100 percent to reduce energy costs and improve bulb life. Control the device remotely with your smartphone and voice commands when connected to a compatible hub or enjoy manual ON/OFF operation from the dimmer. Home automation is simple through custom scenes, versatile scheduling and convenient alerts.

3-WAY READY – The smart device operates perfectly on its own or seamlessly integrates into multi-switch setups with required add-on switches – models 12723 or 46199. Up to four add-on switches can be connected to the same device.

FULL-HOME COVERAGE – Z-Wave Plus works with all previous Z-Wave generations to allow continued expansion of your home-automation network. The dimmer is capable of controlling indoor or outdoor fixtures for whole-home automation and repeats your Z-Wave signal from your hub or other devices to extend your range by up to 150ft. Extended signal range increases your home automation coverage to enhance your control.

EASY INSTALLATION – Requires indoor in-wall installation with hardwired connections. NEUTRAL WIRE REQUIRED. Includes white and light almond paddles (wall plate not included). Full-range dimmability for use with dimmable LEDs and CFLs as well as incandescent and halogen bulbs. Supported wattage – 600W incandescent, 150W CFL/LED. Supported voltage – 120VAC. Operating temperature range 32-104 degrees Fahrenheit.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars896 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
